geneVariantDescriptions.description: MLH1 A681T lies within the C-terminal dimerization domain of the Mlh1 protein (PMID: 22753075). The functional effect of A681T is conflicting as it demonstrates decreased stability resulting in decreased expression of Mlh1 in one study (PMID: 23403630), and has no effect on Mlh1 expression in another study (PMID: 21120944), and demonstrates mismatch repair (MMR) activity similar to wild-type Mlh1 in culture (PMID: 21120944, PMID: 16083711), and intermediate MMR activity in another study (PMID: 31881334), and therefore, its effect on Mlh1 protein function is unknown.

references.title: Expression defect size among unclassified MLH1 variants determines pathogenicity in Lynch syndrome diagnosis.
Functional characterization of MLH1 missense variants identified in Lynch syndrome patients.
Verification of the three-step model in assessing the pathogenicity of mismatch repair gene variants.
Functional significance and clinical phenotype of nontruncating mismatch repair variants of MLH1.
Validation of an in Vitro Mismatch Repair Assay Used in the Functional Characterization of Mismatch Repair Variants.
